bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: I'm running the Fedora 25 Alpha and recently updated to rubygem-fog-libvirt-0.3.0-1.fc25.noarch and rubygem-ruby-libvirt-0.7.0-1.fc25.x86_64. Afterwards any activity with Vagrant leads to the following error:
Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem "fog-libvirt": In Gemfile: vagrant-libvirt was resolved to 0.0.33, which depends on fog-libvirt (= 0.0.3)
Could not find gem 'fog-libvirt (= 0.0.3)', which is required by gem 'vagrant-libvirt', in any of the sources.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): vagrant-libvirt-0.0.33-1.fc25.noarch
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Update to the latest packages in F25 2. Attempt to use a libvirt-provided Vagrant box.

Yes, this is known issue [1]. I'd like to see this resolved upstream in vagrant-libvirt, but the upstream is not responsive ATM :/ so this update is pending in Bodhi.
[1] https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/rubygem-fog-libvirt-0.3.0-1.fc25%20rubygem-ruby-libvirt-0.7.0-1.fc25#comment-494656

rubygem-fog-libvirt-0.3.0-1.fc25, rubygem-ruby-libvirt-0.7.0-1.fc25, vagrant-libvirt-0.0.35-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-2bef97338c

rubygem-fog-libvirt-0.3.0-1.fc25, rubygem-ruby-libvirt-0.7.0-1.fc25, vagrant-libvirt-0.0.35-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
